list.name: Changes
list.comment:
Refactor `LogManager` for enhanced thread safety and efficiency
Encapsulated shared state into a `LogManagerState` structure and replaced `Arc` and `RwLock` with a more efficient `Mutex` for managing the flush thread handle. Updated log record handling to use `Arc` for improved memory management and enhanced commit handling logic to ensure durability guarantees with more precise flushing mechanisms. These changes improve clarity, thread safety, and performance of the logging system.

task.summary: Default task

We enhanced the expression parser to support various join types: INNER JOIN (default) LEFT OUTER JOIN RIGHT OUTER JOIN FULL OUTER JOIN CROSS JOIN We implemented different join constraints: ON constraint (with a condition expression) USING constraint (with column names) NATURAL join (automatic column matching) Implicit CROSS JOIN (no constraint) We added proper handling for these join types and constraints in the process_join_operator and process_join_constraint methods. We created a comprehensive test case that verifies all the join types and constraints work correctly. We fixed all linter errors that came up during implementation, including adding the missing Ident import.
Add test case for the compound identifier
Fix subquery execution
Update expressions to use children pattern

Update limit_plan.rs
- Add test cases

Update plans
- Add test cases

Update mock_expression.rs
- Extend display

Update logical_plan.rs
- Add testcases

Update sort_executor.rs
- Add more testcases

Refactor logical_plan.rs
- Use stack based method to convert logical plan into execution plan to avoid deep recursion

Update execution_engine.rs
- Comment out explain as it causes stack overflow error - Add more test cases

Update value.rs
- Add as_bool - Complete other as_ methods

Update value.rs
- Add as_bool - Complete other as_ methods
Update filter nodes to handle having clause
Updates to improve debug logging

Add ThreadPool implementation
- Add Worker struct - Add ThreadPool struct - Add new, execute and graceful shutdown methods - Add Drop for ThreadPool to gracefully shutdown threadpool
Refactor thread pool to use tokio
Update planner to handle multiple from clauses
Add test runner using the sqllogictest module and slt files
Refactor out the test files into simple and complex
Add primary key support to schema and column structs
Update filter to handle having and where clauses
Add btree page types

Update indexes
- Refactor index folder structure - Add Btree Page types

Update b_plus_tree_leaf_page.rs
- Add test cases

Update b_plus_tree_page.rs
- Add test cases

Add comprehensive test suite for B+ tree internal page
This commit adds a robust set of test cases for the B+ tree internal page implementation, including:
- Basic insertion tests in various orders (ascending, descending, random) - Capacity limit validation - Key lookup and child finding functionality - Key-value removal operations - Edge case handling (single item pages, duplicates) - Helper function to verify B+ tree invariants for each test
These tests ensure the B+ tree internal node implementation properly maintains: - Correct key sorting - Size constraints - Parent-child relationships - Proper behavior during insertions and removals
The test suite helps validate correctness of the B+ tree implementation and ensures reliable data storage operations.
Update Cargo modules

Fix test_complex_queries():
- Having clause must include columns that are in the group by clause as it is evaluated after aggregation.

feat: Implement FilterExecutor and FilterExpression classes
This commit adds the core filtering functionality to the query execution engine:
- Implement FilterExecutor for applying filter predicates to tuples - Add FilterExpression with support for different filter types (WHERE, HAVING) - Add comprehensive test cases for various filtering scenarios - Basic comparison filters (equals, greater than) - Transaction-aware filtering - HAVING clause filters for aggregated results - Edge cases with NULL values and invalid predicates
The implementation allows for efficient filtering of query results based on both row-level predicates and group-level aggregation conditions.

Add B+ Tree implementation with internal node structure
This commit introduces a comprehensive B+ Tree implementation with a focus on internal node management for efficient key-value storage and retrieval operations. The implementation includes:
- Header, internal, and leaf page structures - Key-pointer relationships in internal nodes - Page-based organization supporting disk storage - Memory management integration with buffer pool - Detailed documentation explaining the B+ Tree structure and operations
The README has been updated with detailed explanations of the B+ Tree architecture, page organization, and usage examples.

feat: add page factory module and clean up imports
- Add initial page_factory.rs module to storage/page directory - Update module declaration in mod.rs to include the new module - Remove unused imports in nested_loop_join_executor.rs
The new page factory module will provide a factory pattern implementation for creating different types of pages in the storage system. This commit introduces the structure but the implementation is currently commented out, likely pending further refinement.

Add WAL (Write-Ahead Logging) integration for transaction management
This commit integrates WAL functionality with the transaction system to support database durability and recovery. Key changes include:
- Add WALManager to transaction operations in ExecutionEngine - Extend TransactionManagerFactory to support WAL integration - Implement transaction logging for begin/commit/abort operations - Write transaction records to the write-ahead log during transaction lifecycle - Update database instance initialization to include WAL manager
These changes ensure that transaction operations are properly logged before being committed to the database, supporting the ACID durability property and enabling recovery from crashes.

feat: implement ARIES recovery protocol for database crash recovery
This commit adds the LogRecoveryManager implementation which follows the ARIES (Algorithm for Recovery and Isolation Exploiting Semantics) protocol for database crash recovery. Key components include:
- Three-phase recovery process: Analysis, Redo, and Undo - Transaction table tracking for identifying active transactions at crash time - Dirty page table for efficient recovery of modified pages - Log scanning and replay functionality to ensure database consistency - Integration with existing log manager and buffer pool components - Test framework for verifying recovery operations
The implementation ensures database durability by: 1. Identifying the state of transactions at crash time during analysis 2. Redoing all operations, including those from aborted transactions 3. Undoing any uncommitted transactions to maintain consistency
This complements the recent WAL integration to provide a complete durability and recovery solution for the database system.

Remove `Clone` derive from `Tuple` struct.
The `Clone` derive was unnecessary and has been removed to prevent unintended cloning of `Tuple` objects. This change helps ensure better control over object copying, potentially avoiding performance issues or logical errors.

Refactor WAL manager to use `Arc` for log records
This change wraps log records in `Arc` to ensure they are shared safely and consistently across threads. It also updates the handling of tuples in update records to use `Arc`, improving memory management and concurrency safety.

Refactor transaction and undo log for improved modularity
Reorganized `UndoLog` and `UndoLink` to include constructors, replaced `UndoLog` fields with `Arc` for shared ownership, and added debug logging. Updated transaction operations for better concurrency and simplified testing with advanced undo log handling.

Refactor transaction manager to improve version management.
Introduced `PageVersionInfo` helper methods to encapsulate and simplify version-related operations. Refactored `UndoLog` handling with `Arc` to minimize unnecessary cloning. Improved code readability and maintainability while preserving core functionality.

Reorganize TxnTable and DirtyPageTable implementations
Moved TxnTable and DirtyPageTable implementations to the bottom of the file to improve code organization. This change groups high-level recovery logic and helper structures more logically, enhancing code readability and maintainability.

Reorganize TxnTable and DirtyPageTable implementations
Moved TxnTable and DirtyPageTable implementations to the bottom of the file to improve code organization. This change groups high-level recovery logic and helper structures more logically, enhancing code readability and maintainability.

Refactor `LogManager` for enhanced thread safety and efficiency
Encapsulated shared state into a `LogManagerState` structure and replaced `Arc` and `RwLock` with a more efficient `Mutex` for managing the flush thread handle. Updated log record handling to use `Arc` for improved memory management and enhanced commit handling logic to ensure durability guarantees with more precise flushing mechanisms. These changes improve clarity, thread safety, and performance of the logging system.

option.name: LAST_COMMIT_MESSAGE
option.value:
Refactor `LogManager` for enhanced thread safety and efficiency
Encapsulated shared state into a `LogManagerState` structure and replaced `Arc` and `RwLock` with a more efficient `Mutex` for managing the flush thread handle. Updated log record handling to use `Arc` for improved memory management and enhanced commit handling logic to ensure durability guarantees with more precise flushing mechanisms. These changes improve clarity, thread safety, and performance of the logging system.
